Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 42 for SLE 12 SP5)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 42 for SLE 12 SP5)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-122_156 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2023-4622: Fixed a use-after-free vulnerability in the Unix domain sockets component which could be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation (bsc#1215442).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's af_unix component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.

The unix_stream_sendpage() function tries to add data to the last skb in the peer's recv queue without locking the queue. Thus there is a race where unix_stream_sendpage() could access an skb locklessly that is being released by garbage collection, resulting in use-after-free.

We recommend upgrading past commit 790c2f9d15b594350ae9bca7b236f2b1859de02c.
